revised_title: Ancient Indian Astronomical Observatories and Instruments
tldr: The author, Robert Barker, discovered an ancient observatory in Benares, India, with large, well-preserved astronomical instruments. These instruments, some over twenty feet in height, were built of stone and had accurate divisions and graduations. The observatory, built by Emperor Akbar, demonstrates the knowledge of astronomy among the ancient Bramins and their ability to predict eclipses without the use of optical glasses.
